website_summaries.verdict: Value priced yet capable, it's an apt choice for consumers focused on getting the job done with minimal fuss.
pros: Often on sale for under $150, this moderately priced model is powerful and dependable enough for most home users
The eco-friendly 50cc OxyPower engine keeps emissions to a minimum
cons: A few issues with the chain have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Should have returned it immediately instead of repairing
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried to start this the pull rope broke. Should have returned it then, but I had a nice weekend to get some trees down and I didn't want to wait for a new saw. It has been nothing but a headache since. I was able to repair the pull rope, but every time I need to use it I have to mess with the pull starter rope, pulley and recoil spring to get it to start. Such a huge pain. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H

customer_reviews.title: Powerful heavy & Really Defective
customer_reviews.text: Got my chainsaw today immediately went to work removing stump successfully but chain broke as I finished cutting up pieces NOT GOOD; that wad in 2017; havent used it again until now and its completelt dead despite new spark plug air filter....a piece of junk out on the street tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Grasbefore

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable at ALL!
customer_reviews.text: Starts fine on initial start, but after it warms up, it quits. You may or may not be able to re-crank it. This is by far the WORST chainsaw I have ever bought for my husband! We replaced it with a Huskavarna, absolutely two different ball games. NO ISSUES with the Huskarvana but I would NEVER again buy a Poulan! This chainsaw was taken out after Hurricane Michael and I wish Hurricane Michael would have blew it away because it was absolutely the most useless thing I have ever purchased and unfortunately the time to return time had expired by this time so I was stuck with this JUNK. I tried to give it away, but NO ONE wanted it!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Dilmore

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This One.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great out of the box, ran it five minutes cutting small tree limbs. Thereafter, it will not start, or if it does start it will only run about five to ten seconds before stopping. I have owned many chainsaws, this one is terrible. I have to take a new unit into the repair shop to see why it is defective.
customer_reviews.author: CPALawyer

customer_reviews.title: This saw is great, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t get all the negative reviews. I have owned and worked on 6 saws over the years. This one starts easily and idles nicely. I took down and cut up 2 big trees over 30”diameter. It has plenty of power. I would recommend this to anyone. I use the canned 50:1 fuel and have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: JimG the Jammer

customer_reviews.title: Remember to drain the oil
customer_reviews.text: I love the saw. I have used it steady for two months to cut hardwoods and it has stood up to the challenge. Great power. The only issue is that the chain oiler will continue to feed while the saw is not in use. It will fill the case with oil between uses if you do not remember to drain the remaining oil after use or while you take a break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great homeowner saw
customer_reviews.text: I probably have 20-30 hours of use on this saw so far and for the money, I am really impressed. Granted it is far from a pro saw but it shares a lot of nice touches not found on saws of similar price and knowing it is made by Husqvarna makes me feel confident in its long term durability for occasional homeowner use. The one thing I would recommend is changing the chain out for a nicer quality chain. The stock chain seems to dull quick, even in clean wood and does not cut as nice as even a mid level Oregon chain.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wensell

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I been using this thing for about a year at this point. If you are buying it to use it once and never again. Go for it. Otherwise it's a complete piece of garbage. Under warranty had the entire carburetor break apart. Have a brand new one in that was repaired at one of poulan pro authorized facilities and it can not stay idle. It constantly stalls and to top it off I had to call 3 repair facilities all refused to fix it except for the one. It also constantly bogs down and when you have a tree over u half cut and this thing dies it's not a good feeling. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Runs great.  Cuts even better.  Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Starts right up 2nd pull out of the box. Stored it dry after the first use. Pulled it out of the shed 3 months later on a 34 degree morning. Fired right up on the second pull.(after filling it with gas and oil of course). Ooooooo yea it cuts too! Came with a super sharp Oregon chain. Throws 3" curling's of hardwood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully using both 40:1 or 50:1 engineered pre-mixed fuel. Started right up after following the priming procedure. Chain specs for the 20" bar are: 70 Drive Links 3/8 Pitch .050" Gauge One-Year Update: This is still working excellently after a year of some hard-use. More often than not, starts right up in no more than two or three pull-starts. Would definitely recommend the purchase if considering.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hetzel

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 45 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I was cutting up a dead pine tree and the Chainsaw began to die. I finally got it to idle and waited the 30 seconds as per their recommendation before engaging the throttle. It would just shut down. Did everything instructed from the 50:1 gas ratio to using the primer and choke. Gas was full as well as the chain oil. This should not happen... I ordered a replacement for this one and hope the next one is not defective like the one I just bought. Amazon was great in handling this issue. Peace of mind when buying as a Prime Member.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Glenda Gleaves Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw, using for last few months no problems
customer_reviews.text: Very nice saw for good price, I've been using it for cutting firewood since it arrived packed very well. Starts easily every time, lots of power for 20" saw. I've cut oak logs up bigger than 20 in. No problem, like butter. Like attached chain adjust tool comes in handy. Uses A lot of chain oil, so keep watch. Very happy with purchase, saved me A lot of work.
customer_reviews.author: doityourselfer

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw!
customer_reviews.text: I had a McCullough 16 inch 29 cc saw before. This has so much more power, runs smoother, idles nicely, & seems to be better balanced. First time I fired it up, I knew it was better. Ran it through some 3 inch logs, & just for fun cut them into 6 inch lengths to test the saw. When you shut the saw down & walk away with a smile, you know you bought the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Ginther

customer_reviews.title: Problems with the 20” Poulan Pro
customer_reviews.text: I bought the saw in Dec 2017, to replace my Poulan 18”. I cut down first tree and it worked well. I had a few issues with it staying running, but not a big deal. After about 6 weeks, it started acting up... now it just won’t run well at all. Very disappointing... it had more power, but not working. I replaced the clutch as it felt like it was sticking. Now it won’t run unless chain engaged, but stalls all the time. Calling Poulan ... hope they can help loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: SolarMike

customer_reviews.title: Great in a pinch, homeowner grade.
customer_reviews.text: After Hurricane Michael hit Panama City I ordered this saw online using my phone. It showed up pretty quick it, started and ran and worked well and I still use it but it's a little underpowered. It does tend to bog if the chain isn't absolutely razor sharp and it really sucks gas even the premix that I was using since I couldn't get anything else at the time. I like the saw and I think I paid 160 for it and I will keep it and use it but be advised it is heavy and it's not a commercial grade saw.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done with ease!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Poulan Pro 967061501 50cc 2 Stroke Gas Powered Chain Saw with Carrying Case, 20" to removed a tree that fell on our fence. We have a smaller, electric chainsaw, but it was not strong enough to cut through the trunk of the tree. The Poulon Pro cut right through the trunk with ease. In less than 30 minutes, we had the entire tree cut apart and removed from the fence. Highly recommend this chainsaw for anyone, whether you are experienced or not. It makes cutting so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this saw to replace two Stihls that were no longer working. He was a little hesitant, since this is not supposed to be as great a brand as what he had. He was very happy with it. He says it cuts through wood like butter. after using it to cut up our firewood, he informed me that he doesn't even intend to try to fix his other chainsaws now. He's not happy with this. Most definitely a recommended item.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy to 6 little peanuts

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I don't like the placement of the tighting of the chain option. Buying extra chains was a pain. The book didn't list what chains worked with this saw. I had to call Poulon to find out chains went with this saw. The person explained the E70 chain had to be used with the original bar and if you used an Oregan bar D70 chain had to be used. The saw has worked well when we have used it and was pretty easy to start. I would recommend the saw because it has worked well for us. It's a little heavy but with a 20 inch bar that's expected.
customer_reviews.author: Cudagirl

customer_reviews.title: Crappy White Air filters Rip Easily & You won't Know Until It Stops Running!
customer_reviews.text: Well another Update- Mine has quit running! Somehow the crappy new white air filters split easily & it sucked in dust into the carb. I cannot locate a place to warranty repair this Saw because it's under warranty. I knocked down to 2 stars. I'm South of Houston & when you go to get help it just sends you to Huskavarna website that has no help with a repair center at all.
customer_reviews.author: M Foshee

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed and found it to be a bit heavy. Bigger the engine and bigger the weight. Chain was not adjusted (I expected that) I adjusted the chain and used a can of premixed gas with stabilizer. Bar oil then followed directions. Primed, chocked, 5 pulls and it started. Cut quickly and straight. No problems and no complaints. Comes with 50:1 oil and a full plastic case. The bar wrench has a holder built into the handle (nice addition). I have a 14" electric and 14" Echo for little stuff and this 20" for big stuff
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Received the saw and immediately filled it with fuel, bar oil, and fired it up. After 20 minutes of use the bar oil was running out of the bottom of the saw. Spent over 25 minutes on hold with Poulan support; I finally hung up and called the nearest service dealer - 30 miles away. Their response was bring it in with a receipt and we will see what we can do. I am not satisfied with the saw or Poulan's customer support. Tried calling Poulan support on a different day and time. The recording that I got was that they were experiencing heavy call volume and to call back later - then it hung up.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bogard

customer_reviews.title: Very Hard To Start
customer_reviews.text: It is redicoulsy hard to start this chainsaw. My old 16" Mcculloch would start in the first three pulls after 20 years. This one I literally pulled this thing 100 times before it would start and I only used it once before. I drained the old gas, bought a new spark plug and it still took another 40 pulls to start! I think I changed my plug in my old one once in 20 years. Stay away from this piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brian Bode

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: We had a Poulan for many many years. When it finally gave out, we decided to once again buy Poulan. Big big mistake. After a few uses, we could not get it to start. Brought to a local repair shop and was able to use it once. The second time we went to use it, it would not start again. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: gp

customer_reviews.title: Dead in the water.
customer_reviews.text: Returned the first. The second is no better. Started a few times then nothing. Changed fuel. I got the hand saw out instead. More work trying to start this thing than the job itself. I’m glad I don’t make a living trusting this machine. Buy something better with less plastic that will start. Note: same fuel in all the other 2-cycles works fine.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended but heavy.  Don't hurt your back!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to cut up a massive fallen red pine tree on my property. Paid for itself with this one job. Pros: Powerful. I like the starting guide printed right on the chainsaw itself. Starts pretty easily if you follow the instructions. Cons: Heavy as heck. Can be back breaking if you're not careful. Hate that it needs an oil/gas mixture but maybe that's the way they all are?
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a day and non-existent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and it worked fine for about an hour, then died. Contacted customer support who told it to take it to an 'authorized' shop for repair. Went there and was told they do not work on Poulan. Called support back who said to go to an different shop. Went THERE, and was told they don't work on Poulan. Called customer support who said to take it to ANOTHER shop (this one about a half hour away). Called first this time and was told they don't work on Poulan. Tried to return through Amazon but return attempt only gives you the option of calling customer support. We also bought the extended warranty for $30... which apparently means nothing. $230 paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Ronniegirl

customer_reviews.title: wont run p. o. s. bought a ...
customer_reviews.text: wont run p.o.s. bought a 16" craftsman at ace that's all I want it starts and runs . O well the 20" bar on the poulan fits it
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Stihl
customer_reviews.text: Worst chainsaw I’ve ever used. First time to start it started fine. 2 week later when I was planning to use it also started ok. Ran it for 2 minutes and sat it down, 15 minutes later it wouldn’t start for nothing. Took it to a mechanic and they couldn’t keep it running. 1 week later I was able to pour out the fuel mix and buy pre mix and then it would run it took forever to start and wouldn’t idle and cuts terrible. Seriously the biggest disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Raymond D Jennings Jr

customer_reviews.title: Junk Poulan chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it for my husband for Christmas. He has not been able to saw with it for a than a total of 2 hours. We took it to the repair location we were given. My husband had to purchase a new chain after the original one came off knocked the chain guard off. The chain he just bought has already broke. He's headed back to the repair shop again. I'd paid another $200 to have purchased a good saw. It won't cut through 2' underbrush.
customer_reviews.author: AbbaZabba

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: My old Poulan just up and died after about 15 yrs of hard use ... bought an Echo (real heavy for a 20") but it quit after one day, then checked into a Stihl ... nice but REAL expensive ... back online and found this Poulan at about half the cost of the Stihl ... easy start, easy cutting, modern look and seems to be as good/better than my old one .... can't beat a Poulan for the money ...
customer_reviews.author: Dewman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a beast. At around 15 lbs. it's a little heavy but will cut through wood like a hot knife through butter. Follow the instructions and it's not difficult to crank. If you can't crank it you probably don't need to be using it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable
customer_reviews.text: It worked once. I went crank the second time, nearly ripped my shoulder trying. I pulled and pulled and pulled, then pulled some more. Nope, one and done, glad I bought the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Lemieux

customer_reviews.title: easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: it handles our medium size limbs with ease. has power, easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Nissan

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I owned a Poulan chainsaw for many years and it never give me one minute of trouble. When I needed a new chainsaw that is the main reason I purchased a new Poulan. The new chainsaw has NEVER performed well and now it is very difficult to start, cuts poorly, and is impossible to restart after it gets the least bit hot. I know how to care for a chainsaw, bar and chain. I know the process for start and restart. Regardless of what I have tried nothing works. Unless I am convinced I did not purchase a lemon, I will never purchase another Poulan. John Carroll
customer_reviews.author: John E. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding chainsaw. Easy to use for a beginner. Starts up on first or second pull. Has a great box Uses a bit of oil, more than I was expecting. However having never used a chain saw before I've no clue what I expected it to use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Shorrock

customer_reviews.title: A real disappointment - just seems like they went cheap on this ...
customer_reviews.text: A real disappointment - just seems like they went cheap on this product. It has trouble maintaining an idle and requires constant restarting to get any sort of job done. Also, have had the safety fail to work on 2 different occasions. The blade would run even with the safety in a locked off position. Id look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Swanson

customer_reviews.title: For the price this saw will exceed expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty impressed with this saw. I bought it with a specific tree in mind. It performed well. I am now working on taking down twice the amount of wood after a tree fall and the saw has performed without a hitch. Follow the instructions regarding starting, oil/fuel mix and storage. About a year in of ownership and so far it has meet and exceeded my expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Brand new would not start! (Read review for details.)
customer_reviews.text: New out of box, followed all setup and starting instructions(have used many other brands of saws). WOULD NOT START. Went to local Home Depot, bought an Echo using SAME FUEL - started first pull EVERY TIME for 6hrs of near constant usage with two operators shutting it off only for breaks and refueling. Poulan "P.R.O." - Pull Repeat Obscenities or Procure Reliable Other(brands) *Proper Fuel Mix, Safety Brake Set, Off switch = On, Primed Fuel, Pulled 100 times with choke in various settings. This saw DOES NOT WORK. (Even checked plug wire and spark plug secure)
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stay running
customer_reviews.text: Hard to start. I cut one small branch and it stalled out. It wouldn't stay running to do a very small job. As a homeowner I didn't want to spend 100s on a chainsaw for occasional tasks but after this experience I will have to.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was a 0 star option
customer_reviews.text: 3 words: P.O.S. The companies 1800 number is disconected so dont think you might get some support when your chain wont start, then the chain engages when the trigger isnt even pulled and then it starts smoking until it shuts down. Shame on this company!
customer_reviews.author: aaron holtzer

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw for home
customer_reviews.text: Made by Husqvarna, and it shows. Cuts great, easy start, nice case and parts are readily available. Use it for mainly yard trimming, although it did manage to get through my giant brush pike from the trees that were taken down to work on my septic field. Like a hot knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Price

customer_reviews.title: Polan Pro chan saw
customer_reviews.text: Works okay, however, under load stalls, and quality of design is not as good as I expected. should work okay for home applicatrions, howerver, I would not trust it for long life and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Patton

customer_reviews.title: Poulan Pro Chainsaw ( gas powered )
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he loves it ! He’s real picky so this means this is a great product! He uses it every weekend and never has a problem with it .
customer_reviews.author: lisalisa38

customer_reviews.title: Item doesn't work and NOT RETURNABLE.
customer_reviews.text: The saw quit cutting properly after less than an hour's use. I've tried all the troubleshooting steps in the manual and watched several videos. I would return it but it's not eligible because it runs on gasoline. I'm out $200 for a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Joyner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Poulan pro 2050 and this one is living up to it’s new reputation based on improved performance. Easy to star, only needs 3 primes, then after 3 pulls it starts. Moving choke to mid point, then another 3 pulls and it starts. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: >> This chain saw is a great deal for the price !...I've used it about 5 times now... It always starts with no problem ( unlike the other ones I've had ) and cuts great ! No complaints at all so far !!
customer_reviews.author: MoNgOhAtEsWiNtEr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Chainsaw!!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know what some of the other reviewers are talking about this chainsaw is easy to start if you follow the instructions. This thing as taken down now three very large tree's on my property. One of being a 70 foot Black Walnut tree 30 inch in Dia. This also came with a carrying case. If your looking for an great chainsaw you have found it!!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Man

customer_reviews.title: Good vallue for larger saw.
customer_reviews.text: So it actually a great chainsaw, but take it directly to the sae shop and have it tuned. They send them out too lean at idle always shutting off. Saw shop had it tuned up and it runs lije a rapes ape. Plenty of piwer. Starts easy after tune.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, but does not always restart when shut off for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.text: We have a creek behind our house and some large Oak trees have fallen into the creek (around 15 inches in diameter where I cut out sections). The Poulan Pro 50 cc cut right through it many times faster than my old Craftsman 38cc. Most of the time, I would stop the saw after each cut to move for the next cut as I was in about a foot of water most of the time. When the saw would not restart, I would wait awhile. If it still did not start, it would start the next day. I would rate it a 5 if I could always restart it. Great chainsaw for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I almost bought this same chainsaw as a reconditioned model...
customer_reviews.text: ...for the same price. I am glad I always compare with Amazon before buying elsewhere. Great saw! I had a 12" diameter, 14' limb come down from a large oak. This saw cut it into 20" lengths in less than three minutes after the first time I started it with only one pull. Another satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jmc7228

customer_reviews.title: won't run
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use until it was needed 6 weeks after purchase. It started right up first time but wouldn't stay running. After about the 5th restart it quit and now won't start at all. Gas mix was proper (I've used a lot of chain saws in my time). I was able to make just a few cuts of max 3 inch diameter branches and it cut great while it lasted. I used it for the first time 1 day after return window closed so can't return. Now I am stuck with a brand new saw that won't run. I have been on hold with Poulan help line for close to an hour now... listened to the repeating diddy ad nauseum.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Edminster

customer_reviews.title: will not work
customer_reviews.text: The product will not start. It will not run. Customer service? HA HA HA AH
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for refurbs!
customer_reviews.text: This is hard to start. Initially would not fire-up at all. Son-in-law took apart and found fuel line was not connected. This was a manufacturer error, and the seller did NOT research the original return issue at all!
customer_reviews.author: pamela renkel

customer_reviews.title: New saw
customer_reviews.text: Waited till I used this saw to write this, 3rd poulan I have owned, really good saw cut two weekends running, no issues , she is a little finicky to start , slightly under powered but tried and true poulan , I really like mine ,
customer_reviews.author: Scott Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't start .
customer_reviews.text: I used ethanol free gas mixed with oil at 50: 1 like instructed. The saw would not start. I tried several for several hours. I am dismayed that this new saw would not start. I will call warranty support but may send it back before Sep 22.
customer_reviews.author: Don W. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Durable vs Pricepoint
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Approximately 10 gallons of fuel through it. Still on original chain(I sharpen every second fuel fill up) I've been pretty rough on it, solid 6-8hrs straight running multiple days.... It's still kickin chickin.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Chain saw never fired!
customer_reviews.text: Never got the chain saw to fire! Called Paulan and they told me it needed a carberator adjustment. I got busy and didn't take it to small engine repair. Would like to send it back!
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fired up and ran perfectly, made short work of the few trees I started with.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Like the brake, chain won't move when starting
customer_reviews.text: Easy start great saw, some Husqvarna innovation are incorporated into the Polan pro. For the price 5stars
customer_reviews.author: ChBa

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this saw for newly acquired property, had several trees to fall and cut.the saw started right up 5th pull and worked flawlessly, some reviews said hard to start however it fired up and ran perfect. Use the 50:1 ready fuel which is premixed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a 20" workhorse this is the one to buy. You can't beat the price and works fine . The only thing is don't prime as much as they tell you, 10 times is to much. Suggest 3-5 pumps.
customer_reviews.author: Bree Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money if you need a budget chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Helped purchase this my neighbor next door and he absolutely loves it. Only down side we have noticed is it likes to use alot of bar oil especially compared to my craftsman but other then its easy to work on and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Rsimm26

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after Hurricane Michsel for the clean up. It worked great and has paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Hartwell

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Having used this several times now here is what I have found: It is very hard to start, and to keep running when at idle. This thing constantly rattles itself apart. Numerous times the bar nuts have rattled loose despite tightening them properly, you can imagine the danger this causes. The last time I was unable to recover the parts lost in the woods so I trashed this one and bought a Husqvarna.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The handle looks week. But other than that it looks to be a nice piece of equipment. It runs well and is not hard to start.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Best Saw for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Great Saw - Nice to have a saw that has the power, length, and a great chain to really cut up wood. What used to take me hours, is now in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw
customer_reviews.text: It's been lasting good. Used for a whole year And still running strong
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: N/A
customer_reviews.text: Good saw but squirts a little too much chain oil out. After some cutting the bar oil hole gets covered with sawdust and blocks the excess out. Cuts through wood like butter, haven't used it on anything over a foot in diameter though.
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: Starts easy plenty of power and good chain oiling
customer_reviews.text: Have had for months and used often. Starts easy plenty of power and good chain oiling. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gordo Shumway

customer_reviews.title: Good entry level saw.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than the big box stores. Great chainsaw for the price. I’ve used it several times now, starts easily and runs great. Has plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: Tatum A Combs

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Yes oil comes out and you think it a leak . No . The chain lubrication is gravity fed it will feed oil until it's empty that might take a while....but think about it...Good service.easy starting..I have my 14"and 16" for 8 years still helps me in the woods
customer_reviews.author: Harry Troy

customer_reviews.title: but it was replaced and the one that I received runs like a top
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for firewood. Had some issues with the first one, but it was replaced and the one that I received runs like a top!
customer_reviews.author: Lance M. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: BEST PRICE ANYWHERE !!! GREAT CHAINSAW
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for the best price and best power and size. Amazon had the best price with the longest chain and most power. Dont buy anywhere else but amazon
customer_reviews.author: Casey Schaff

customer_reviews.title: Basically a Husqvarna
customer_reviews.text: Basically a Husqvarna, and it runs just as great. It came off the same line as a model of Husq. It did come with the wrong chain however, and it took a while to figure that out. Since then it's been great, reliable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Moum

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saw for my very old father in law who'd wear himself out cranking on other saws. Easy to start, does the job well. I recommend this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Handycandyman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We live in a wooded area and there is always a tree that needs attention. Took it right out of the box and cut down a tree. Would have done another but my back went out before the chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: SurfCityGal

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last week. Seems to work well. Starts pretty easily if you follow the instructions. Bogs a little when cutting large logs but, that could just be me getting used to it. OEM chain is pretty durable. I bought a spare anyway. Thus far I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack & Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute great saw. Has the power needed for a huge red wood oak that fell in my yard. Great value for the price. Easy crank.
customer_reviews.author: randy wawa

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied - Powerful Enough - Chain Issue
customer_reviews.text: 2nd Poulan chainsaw. I'm cutting down 10inch diameter tress. Chain rarely gets stuck. It's light enough not to wear on me. It gets the job done. Only issue is that the chain needs to get tightened once almost every tree. My old one just once before I started the day.
customer_reviews.author: Skid

customer_reviews.title: So far very happy. Strong motor just wondering how plastic housing will ...
customer_reviews.text: So far very happy. Strong motor just wondering how plastic housing will hold up
customer_reviews.author: BARRY VANSANT

customer_reviews.title: not really happy since i just started to use it
customer_reviews.text: bought this chain saw in January , I started to use it this spring and it would not stay running for me ! it would start once and if you shut it down, will not restart! not really happy since i just started to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: had trees, have logs
customer_reviews.text: very powerful, love it, even Tim the tool man would love it
customer_reviews.author: Las Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this it junk
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy mine is new will not work out of warranty It was spare went to use will not start stuck with junk Thanks amazon
customer_reviews.author: edd f

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: So far, it works great. You will have to adjust the throttle out of the box. For the money, it's a great chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: the blue tab to start the saw broke after two uses
customer_reviews.text: We used the chain saw two times and the blue tab became loose disengaged so the saw does not work the motor suns but does not engage the chain Should have bought a Sthiel (sic)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: The first one we bought broke within an hour. And not just any break. The entire shaft/handle area split in two making it inoperable. We got a replacement and I am eager to see how long this one holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Rkruse3

customer_reviews.title: So long unwanted trees
customer_reviews.text: Love this chainsaw. Starts right up and works like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Oddone76

customer_reviews.title: Steer Clear
customer_reviews.text: Seek the similar reviews - problems with idling at full speed, carburetor issues, leaking oil and restart issues after using for 20 mins. After less than 3 hours of total use, I knew this product was a mistake purchase. I absolutely do not recommend this chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: ECMD

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: Awesome saw for the money.. Make sure you use high octane gas when mixing. When I use low test it doesn't seem to want to start and stay running. Probably why some people on here were having trouble getting it started..
customer_reviews.author: allen

customer_reviews.title: Starts easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a strong built saw and does the job it’s built to do!
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Used equipment being sold as new.
customer_reviews.text: Finally opened my chainsaw and saw this. It was used and heavily used. It was cleaned but definitely NOT new.
customer_reviews.author: chuckc

customer_reviews.title: but has great cutting power
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy than I thought, but has great cutting power. Like to have never got it started the first time. Followed the instructions, but had to let it run for about 5 minutes in idle mode before it would stay running.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Worked well until you turned it off. Then it would not restart again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the part time woodsman
customer_reviews.text: The saw is what you would think it would be I have now owned three of these saws. I use the saw 20 hours a year and it works just fine the redesigned blade tightening system is nice compared to older versions User friendly easy to handle
customer_reviews.author: josh abbe

customer_reviews.title: May have had a bad chain
customer_reviews.text: Used three times, chain fell off and self destructed. Was great until then,
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good chainsaw, so far...!
customer_reviews.text: Just used it one day and can’t complain. It has an Huskvarna engine. I gave it a four because I think that with time and use, some of the plastic parts will break. Which is why I bought the extended warranty (for very little). So far, very good!!
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Excellent chainsaw! Easy to operate with all the right safety features.
customer_reviews.author: Lwood

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This saw works as advertised. Definitely follow the instructions to start it. I cuts really well as one would expect. My only beef is that when you set it down and it is idle mode it stalls quite often, but it starts right up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: It won't start at all if it's cold. When it's warm it will only start half the time.
customer_reviews.author: Waterboy

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.  Says it's not returnable
customer_reviews.text: Had it one day used it twice just to try it out and nuts came off and are gone and chain won't stay on. Now I'm being told it's not returnable. NOT HAPPY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Poulan Pro 20 in. 50cc 2-Cycle Gas Chainsaw, PR5020
product_meta.description: This 20 in. chainsaw is powerful and easy to start and operate. It is a robust, all-around model with low weight, equipped with OxyPower engine for more power, lower emission levels and lower fuel consumption. Quick and easy to start, it features Soft Start, purge and integrated choke/stop controls. There is easy handling and maintenance with convenient side adjust chain tensioning along with easy access clips on the cylinder cover for fast access to filter and spark plug. The Combi tool is integrated in the rear handle. Backed by a 2-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: With the OxyPower engine technology, you can get that extra power for virtually any task. This technology offers a more powerful engine, but also 70% less emissions and 20% lower fuel consumption
Effortless pull starting system reduces pull force 30% for easier starting and reduced wear on the starter mechanism
The combi tool is integrated into the rear handle, it's always there when you need it for maintenance
The purge bulb, which provides the carburetor with fuel and makes the product easier to start with fewer pulls, is protected, reducing the risk of damage
User friendly combined choke/stop control allows faster starting and greater reliability by reducing the risk of engine flooding

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars387 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
